text:
Basiques

Retour à la ligne : Terminer la ligne par deux espaces
Insérer directement du html : Commencer la ligne par 4 espaces

Headers

# H1
## H2
### H3

Emphasis

Mot en italique: *astérisques* ou _underscores_.
Mot en gras: **double astérisques** ou __double underscores__.

Lists

1. First ordered list item
2. Another item
⋅⋅* Unordered sub-list.
1. Actual numbers don't matter, just that it's a number
⋅⋅1. Ordered sub-list
4. And another item.

⋅⋅⋅You can have properly indented paragraphs within list items. Notice the blank line above, and the leading spaces (at least one, but we'll use three here to also align the raw Markdown).

⋅⋅⋅To have a line break without a paragraph, you will need to use two trailing spaces.⋅⋅
⋅⋅⋅Note that this line is separate, but within the same paragraph.⋅⋅
⋅⋅⋅(This is contrary to the typical GFM line break behaviour, where trailing spaces are not required.)

* Unordered list can use asterisks
- Or minuses
+ Or pluses

Liens

[I'm an inline-style link](https://www.google.com)

[I'm an inline-style link with title](https://www.google.com "Google's Homepage")

[I'm a reference-style link][Arbitrary case-insensitive reference text]

[I'm a relative reference to a repository file](../blob/master/LICENSE)

[You can use numbers for reference-style link definitions][1]

Or leave it empty and use the [link text itself]

Some text to show that the reference links can follow later.

Ancres

Poser l'ancre

Il faut utiliser la syntaxe HTML pour créer des ids sur les balises où on veut poser l'ancre.

Exemple :
S'il s'agit d'un titre, alors : <h1 id="mon_ancre">Texte de l'header</h1>

Referencer l'ancre

Avec une balise a, il faut utiliser le href avec /pages/[l_url_de_la_page]#[l_ancre].

  • l_url_de_la_page où on a posé les ancres, est le premier champ de texte qu'on renseigne lorsqu'on crée une page et que permet de generer l'url.
  • l_ancre l'id de l'élément où on a posé l'ancre.


    • Exemple :
    Pour referencer le titre d'avant : <a href="/pages/url_page#mon_ancre">Texte du lien</a>
    ou [Texte du lien](/pages/url_page#mon_ancre)

    Images

    Here's our logo (hover to see the title text):

    Inline-style:
    ![alt text](https://github.com/adam-p/markdown-here/raw/master/src/common/images/icon48.png "Logo Title Text 1")

    Reference-style:
    ![alt text][logo]

    Tableaux

    Colons can be used to align columns.

    | Tables | Are | Cool |
    | ------------- |:-------------:| -----:|
    | col 3 is | right-aligned | $1600 |
    | col 2 is | centered | $12 |
    | zebra stripes | are neat | $1 |

    The outer pipes (|) are optional, and you don't need to make the raw Markdown line up prettily. You can also use inline Markdown.

    Markdown | Less | Pretty
    --- | --- | ---
    *Still* | `renders` | **nicely**
    1 | 2 | 3

    Inline HTML

    Definition list

    Is something people use sometimes.


    Markdown in HTML

    Does *not* work **very** well. Use HTML tags.
